personality_traits.name: 2D Character Lover
personality_traits.description:
This character is into 2D characters. Whether or not they prefer 2D over 3D does not matter, the only thing that matters is they love 2D characters.

Example character: c9788

personality_traits.name: Absentminded
personality_traits.description: This character is absentminded. Absent-mindedness is a mental condition in which the subject experiences low levels of attention and frequent distraction. Absent-mindedness is not a diagnosed condition but rather a symptom of boredom and sleepiness which people experience in their daily lives. When suffering from absent-mindedness, people tend to show signs of memory lapse and weak recollection of recently occurring events. This can usually be a result of a variety of other conditions often diagnosed by clinicians such as ADD and depression. In addition to absent-mindedness leading to an array of consequences affecting daily life, it can have as more severe, long-term problems.

personality_traits.name: Adaptive
personality_traits.description: This character is adaptive. These characters are able to easily adjust to new situations and change their behavior to fit the demands of their environment. They are willing to bend and break habits, to challenge themselves when their circumstances change. They tend to face problems, pivot among distractions, and proceed forward. Adaptable people are prone to think ahead and consistently focus on improvement.

personality_traits.name: Airhead
personality_traits.description: This character sometimes acts like a fool. Foolishness is the lack of wisdom. In this sense it differs from stupidity, which is the lack of intelligence.

personality_traits.name: Ambitious
personality_traits.description: An ambitious person is defined as a person with an earnest desire for some type of achievement or distinction, such as power, honor, fame, or wealth, and the willingness to strive for its attainment.

personality_traits.name: Antisocial
personality_traits.description: This character is antisocial. Different from just being shy or reserved, antisocial people are unwilling or unable to associate normally with other people. They may or may not be a hikikomori.

personality_traits.name: Bookworm
personality_traits.description: This character loves reading books a lot, and may spend most of their free time on it.

personality_traits.name: Brave
personality_traits.description: This character is not afraid to face the danger head-on. They're always ready to defend their country or close people, and fulfill their duty, even if it means death.

personality_traits.name: Cautious
personality_traits.description: This character is cautious. Cautious characters are on their guard, acting with caution and watching their surroundings with alertness. Aside from the people that are required to be cautious as a part of their jobs, like guards or military personnel, it is also noticed in the behaviors of people that have been in prolonged conflicts or dangerous environments.

personality_traits.name: Charismatic
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is a charismatic person. Charisma is defined as the "compelling attractiveness or charm that can inspire devotion in others". Charismatic people are charming, friendly and extroverted people with great social skills. They tend to be good public speakers and street smart.

personality_traits.name: Cinephile
personality_traits.description: This trait means a character who is fond of motion pictures.

personality_traits.name: Clumsy
personality_traits.description: This character is clumsy or known to be prone to accidents. A clumsy person is someone lacking in skill or physical coordination, who tends to be prone to more accidents then others. Accident-proneness, also known as clumsiness, is the conception that some people might have predisposition, or that they might be more likely to suffer accidents, such as car crashes and industrial injuries, than other people. It may be used as a reason to deny any insurance on such individuals.

personality_traits.name: Competitive
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is competitive. Competitive people have a strong desire to compete or to succeed. They typically hate to lose.

personality_traits.name: Confident
personality_traits.description: This character is confident. A confident person is sure of oneself; having no uncertainty about one's own abilities, correctness or success.

personality_traits.name: Coward
personality_traits.description: A cowardly character is someone who is lacking in courage in battles or fights. This character will runaway most of the time without thinking much about it. Popular examples would be Matou Shinji and Zenitsu from Kimetsu no Yaiba. Do not confuse this trait with Hetare. Hetare is associated with an inability in making decision, while Coward is associated in facing danger and challange.

personality_traits.name: Creative
personality_traits.description: Creative characters are excellent at using their imagination and thinking outside the box to come up with new ideas. They can come up with unexpected solutions and give a unique perspective on events.

personality_traits.name: Cruel
personality_traits.description: This character exhibits significant amounts of cruelty, which refers to actions that cause others to suffer. Their feelings should be malicious, indifferent, or otherwise lack remorse for the actions they commit while aware of their consequences.

personality_traits.name: Curious
personality_traits.description: This character is curious (as in eager to learn something). A curious person often wants to know more just about anything that (s)he encounters. A curious person is willing to learn new things, and likes to question the people around them.

personality_traits.name: Cynic
personality_traits.description: This character acts in a cynical way, showing contempt for accepted standards of honesty or morality by one's actions, especially by actions that exploit the scruples of others. It has little to no relation to Greek philosophy cynicism. A cynical person believes that only selfishness motivates human actions and disbelieves in or minimizes selfless acts or disinterested points of view.

personality_traits.name: Deredere
personality_traits.description:
This character is a deredere, lovestruck from the begining of the story.

Deredere characters are deeply in love with someone from the begining or early parts of the story and this is the centerpoint of all of their actions.

personality_traits.name: Dishonest
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is dishonest. Perhaps they're not frequently dishonest (e.g., like a con artist or a pathological liar would be), but a dishonest act in the story defines their character and/or is a prominent plot point. Dishonesty is to act without honesty. It is used to describe a lack of probity, cheating, lying or being deliberately deceptive or a lack in integrity, knavishness, perfidiosity, corruption or treacherousness.

personality_traits.name: Docile
personality_traits.description: This character is docile. Different from being shy or timid, docile people are not outgoing and are typically very compliant.

personality_traits.name: Dogmatic
personality_traits.description: This character is dogmatic. Dogmatic characters are very firm in their convictions, which usually come from some authority. The authority is often religious, but it doesn't have to be. They are inclined to lay down principles as undeniably true even despite evidence to the contrary.

personality_traits.name: Donkan
personality_traits.description:
This character is blind against all romantic feelings and actions of people nearby.

Donkan characters can't read the atmosphere at all. Some donkans may be smart like a genius but they still can't understand the romantic feelings of anyone until a clear confession is made. Even than they need to ask for a confirmation and think about it for a while.

personality_traits.name: Effeminate
personality_traits.description: Effeminate characters are lacking in "manliness". He is unsure of himself and may act girlish. Not being able to fight back, he may become the subject of bullying by classmates. He blushes and loses the power of speech in the girl's company. Also refers to male characters who engage in activities considered typical of the gender role of a girl- e.g. wearing feminine clothing or makeup. Only use this for characters who are (or seem to be) male.

personality_traits.name: Emotional
personality_traits.description: An emotional person is somebody that is easily affected by feelings. Emotional people are prone to making decisions based on feelings and impulses rather than logic, pragmatism or reason.

personality_traits.name: Energetic
personality_traits.description: This character is unusually energetic. Hyperactivity can be described as a physical state in which a person is abnormally active. The colloquial term hyper is used to describe someone who is in a hyperactive state.

personality_traits.name: Envious
personality_traits.description: A character with this personality trait is frequently envious of others' various physical and non-physical possessions. Envy is a resentment which occurs when someone lacks another's quality, achievement or possession and wishes that the other lacked it. Though used synonymously with Jealousy in modern English, the two words are different.

personality_traits.name: Family Oriented
personality_traits.description:
This character places a great importance on the notion of "family".

"Family" can mean either the family the character comes from (siblings, father, mother, etc.) or the family they establish (husband / wife, daughter, son, etc.) or both.

personality_traits.name: Fear of Commitment
personality_traits.description:
The character is afraid of a long-term commitment to someone, saying otherwise, they are afraid of love. It's not a mental illness and can take different forms, depending on the person.

This fear is usually expressed by the rejection of those declaring their love or wanting to take the relationship to the next level (like marriage), possibly rethinking their actions later, when the fear has diminished.

personality_traits.name: Feminist
personality_traits.description: This character is a feminist. Feminism is a range of social movements, political movements, and ideologies that aim to define and establish the political, economic, personal, and social equality of the sexes. Make sure to only apply this tag when the character is explicitly described as a feminist or is mentioned to want equality between genders either by themselves or another character.

personality_traits.name: Flustered
personality_traits.description: The character easily panics and gets flustered easily. Usually when things does not go as planned/expected, the character will lose composure and panic and possibly screw up in some way.

personality_traits.name: Food Lover
personality_traits.description: This character loves to eat and is often, if not always, hungry.

personality_traits.name: Funny
personality_traits.description: This character is usually considered funny. Humour or humor is the tendency of particular cognitive experiences to provoke laughter and provide amusement. People of all ages and cultures respond to humour. The majority of people are able to experience humour, i.e., to be amused, to laugh or smile at something funny, and thus they are considered to have a sense of humour. The hypothetical person lacking a sense of humour would likely find the behaviour induced by humour to be inexplicable, strange, or even irrational. Though ultimately decided by personal taste, the extent to which an individual will find something humorous depends upon a host of variables, including geographical location, culture, maturity, level of education, intelligence and context.

personality_traits.name: Genre Savvy
personality_traits.description:
This character knows a lot about the situation, just not personally.
 
Genre savvy characters may be unfamiliar with their current situation, never experienced it before, but they certainly did read a story, saw a movie or played a game about "just the same thing". They would try to use these "experiences" to their advantage at every opportunity.

personality_traits.name: Gloomy
personality_traits.description: The character's personality is filled with melancholy and have a downcast attitude. They're the opposite of cheerful.

personality_traits.name: Gossipy
personality_traits.description: This character often engages in spreading gossip or rumors.

personality_traits.name: Grumbler
personality_traits.description:
This character is grumbler.

The position of such characters is to go against the opinion of others and to complain about any events that occur around them. Such people are quite difficult to please.

personality_traits.name: Hard Worker
personality_traits.description:
This character is a hardworking person.

Hardworker refers to a person that spends a lot of effort to succeed at the assigned tasks and achieve his/her goals.

personality_traits.name: Henpecked
personality_traits.description: This character may seem cool and brutal for the audience until the moment his wife/girlfriend will come and say her word. In her presence he immediately becomes compliant and obedient. In other words, this kind of people humbly recognizes the leadership and authority of their woman. In some comedic stories women can even use a frying pan or other painful tool as an argument. Note that this trait has nothing to do with sexual submission. Use Submissive Partner in this case.

personality_traits.name: Hetare
personality_traits.description: This character is Hetare which is the opposite of Proactive. This character is a worthless, spineless, undependable, lazy, inept and no help to anyone and most of the time unable to make any decisions in time. This character is always being pushed around by every other characters in the game at the very start and they are still like that in the final moments of the game. They make other characters help them everytime before facing their own problems. Please don't use this trait on games that have this character starting this way but also has him fixing his ways in the first hours of the game. Thus making it somewhat bearable by some quick reading. While this description says man, this trait can also be applied to worthless, spineless, good for nothing female characters.

personality_traits.name: Himedere
personality_traits.description: A character that demands to be treated like royalty by his or her loved ones and may or may not actually be royalty.

personality_traits.name: Honest
personality_traits.description: This character is honest. Honesty is associated with virtues such as integrity, truthfulness, and straightforwardness.

personality_traits.name: Honorable
personality_traits.description: This character is someone of honor. A honorable character acts in accordance with principles of honor, with dignity, distinction, and an illustrious, noble and distinguished way. There are many definitions to being honorable, some are: The Bushido code of the samurai that is said to have emphasized virtues such as loyalty, honor, obedience, duty, filial piety, and self-sacrifice. Chivalry of medieval knights with ideals of knightly virtues, honor and courtly love, pride aspiring to beauty, and formalized pride giving rise to a conception of honor, which is states as the pole of noble life. It should be noted that the principle idea is not being "good", but being "just" and "true to one's word" and in that sense even criminal organizations such as Yakuza consider themselves honorable. This trait is intended to be used for characters that make it into a habit to mention that they are honorable, bound by a code of honor like Bushido or chivalry, just, fair, true-to-their-word, etc. And should not be applied to every character that looks honest.

personality_traits.name: Humble
personality_traits.description: Humble characters tend to undersell themselves and don't try to take the spotlight. They are not haughty, proud or arrogant.

personality_traits.name: Idealist
personality_traits.description:
This character is an idealist, someone who is absorbed with living life the way they perceive it should be. They purposely overlook the darkness of human nature in favor of seeing everyone in an unrealistically good light. To an idealist, there are no such things as bad people. There are only bad situations people are in that force them to act a certain way. Finally, an idealist is someone who expects the best from people, not realizing that not everyone is willing to give up their time or money as willing as they are.

The opposite of a cynic, an idealist often has the nature of selflessness and believes in things like honor, justice, honesty, etc.

personality_traits.name: Idiot
personality_traits.description: This character sometimes acts like an idiot. An idiot is a mentally deficient person, or someone who acts in a self-defeating or significantly counterproductive way.

personality_traits.name: Ignorant
personality_traits.description: This character is or seems ignorant and lacking common sense. Ignorant characters are unaware of most things that are considered common knowledge by regular people. It is not because they are incapable of learning, but usually because they just never got the chance to learn or didn't try. They don't understand the things that are considered obvious by most people because their thought process is different doesn't usually end with the same results with others. Their actions might seem stupid, meaningless and outright wrong, but that doesn't mean that they are stupid, cruel or evil, they are usually just different. An ignorant character may be from a distant place or time or maybe he/she just got out of prison, or returned from a prolonged conflict. An ignorant character is different from an uneducated one since it is not about education. Though a character may carry both of the traits.

personality_traits.name: Immature
personality_traits.description: This character doesn't act maturely. Maturity is a psychological term used to indicate how a person responds to the circumstances or environment in an appropriate manner.

personality_traits.name: Incorruptible
personality_traits.description:
This character is morally strong enough not to be persuaded to do anything wrong: his way of thinking will not deteriorate and will not be destroyed by anyone, no matter how difficult his experiences.

This trait can be used (for example) for a character who can not be corrupted by money or for a character who is violated (by proxy or otherwise) by others but who would remain "loyal" to his lover and do not succumb to pleasures given of his rapist.

personality_traits.name: Insightful
personality_traits.description:
This character has a high perception of what other people do and think. They often see through of what other people is hiding, making them a dependable friend or a formidable opponent.

This might be caused by a long term of experience of observing people's act and conduct, or just simply have the talent for it which caused by their very own nature, such as having attentive care for others or merely being sly and deceitful.

Note: Don't apply this trait to those who use telepathy.

personality_traits.name: Japanophile
personality_traits.description: This character is a non-Japanese that is obsessed with Japan in general and/or Japanese culture in particular.

personality_traits.name: Jealous
personality_traits.description: A character with this personality trait is often jealous of others. Jealousy is an emotion, and the word typically refers to the negative thoughts and feelings of insecurity, fear, and anxiety over an anticipated loss of something of great personal value, particularly in reference to an existing connection. Jealousy often consists of a combination of emotions such as anger, resentment, inadequacy, helplessness and disgust. Though jealous is used synonymously with Envious in modern English, the two words are different.

personality_traits.name: Jock
personality_traits.description: This character is refered to as a Jock. The term jock, when used in the United States and Canada, refers to the classic stereotype of a male athlete. It is generally a negative stereotype, and is attributed mostly to high school and college athletics participants who form a distinct youth subculture. In sociology, the jock is thought to be included within the socialite subculture, which also contains the preps and Ivy-Leaguers. As a blanket term, jock can be considered synonymous with athlete. Similar words that may mean the same as "jock" include "meathead," "musclebrain," and "musclehead." These terms are based on the stereotype that a jock is muscular, but not very smart, and cannot carry a conversation on any topic other than one relating to sports or exercise. This trait does not refer to the job but the personality stereotype that comes with the people that are usually associated with this job.

personality_traits.name: Kind
personality_traits.description: This character is kind. Kindness is the act or the state of being kind —ie. marked by goodness and charitable behaviour, mild disposition, pleasantness, tenderness and concern for others. It is known as a virtue, and recognized as a value in many cultures and religions.

personality_traits.name: Kuudere
personality_traits.description:
This character is a kuudere, starts uninterested but turns lovestruck later.

A kuudere starts cold, distant, uninterested and doesn't pay any attention to  potential love interests, but eventually turns lovestruck. Unlike the classic type, a kuudere doesn't get hostile with the other characters, but just ignores them.

personality_traits.name: Lazy
personality_traits.description: This character is a lazy person. Laziness (also called indolence) is a disinclination to activity or exertion despite having the ability to do so.

personality_traits.name: Loner
personality_traits.description: This character has a lone wolf type personality.

personality_traits.name: Loyal
personality_traits.description: During the story, this character exhibits behavior associated with the theme of loyalty. Loyalty is faithfulness or a devotion to a person, country, group, or cause.

personality_traits.name: Lucky
personality_traits.description: This character has abnormally good luck. This might be a supernatural ability, or just the perception of other characters around them.

personality_traits.name: Mature
personality_traits.description:
This character has a mature personality.

In terms of personality, this is a person fully developed in terms of thinking. If used to refer to a young person, their behavior is not typical of their age, as this person usually acts like a grown up or a more aged and wise one.

personality_traits.name: Misandrist
personality_traits.description: This character is a misandrist (one who hates men). Misandry is the hatred or dislike of men or boys. Misandry is the antonym of philandry, the fondness, love, or admiration of men. Misandry is a back-formation from misogyny, the hatred or dislike of women.

personality_traits.name: Misanthrope
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is a misanthrope. Misanthropy is the general hatred, distrust or disdain of the human species or human nature. A misanthrope, or misanthropist is someone who holds such views or feelings.

personality_traits.name: Mischievous
personality_traits.description:
This character is mischievous.

Mischievous characters like to cause trouble in a playful way. Their actions may or may not be an annoyance to people around them.

personality_traits.name: Misogynist
personality_traits.description: This character is a misogynist, a person who hates, dislikes, mistrusts, or mistreats women. Misogyny is the hatred or dislike of women or girls. Misogyny can be manifested in numerous ways, including sexual discrimination, denigration of women, violence against women, and sexual objectification of women. Misogyny has been characterised as a prominent feature of the mythologies of the ancient world as well as various religions. In addition, many influential Western philosophers have been described as misogynistic. The male counterpart of misogyny is misandry, the hatred or dislike of men; the antonym of misogyny is philogyny, the love or fondness of women.

personality_traits.name: Money Lover
personality_traits.description:
This character has a goal of obtaining money anyway possible. Usually with a 'get rich quick scheme' or demanding money frequently.
This can also mean a character who does not like spending money, like those old meany misers.

personality_traits.name: Moody
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is moody. Regardless of whether they have an actual mental condition or not, their moods change at the drop of a hat. Moody characters tend to also be impulsive and whimsical.

personality_traits.name: Naive
personality_traits.description: This character is naive. Naive refers to someone having or showing a lack of experience, understanding or sophistication, someone having or showing unaffected simplicity of nature or absence of artificiality.

personality_traits.name: Nature Lover
personality_traits.description: These characters has a special place in their hearts for the environment, wildlife and plant life.

personality_traits.name: Nihilist
personality_traits.description: This character is a nihilist. In popular use, the term commonly refers to someone who has the belief that life is without intrinsic value, meaning, or purpose. Only apply this trait to characters who are described as nihilists in universe, or have beliefs that are reflective of a nihilistic point of view.

personality_traits.name: No Sense of Direction
personality_traits.description: This person tends to get lost very easily, even in familiar environment.

personality_traits.name: Obsessive
personality_traits.description:
The character has an obsession with something, or has a tendency to form obsessions.

An obsession is an intense or passionate fixation on a specific subject. While obsessiveness tends to have associations with unhealthy or abnormal fixations, it doesn't necessarily bely unhealthiness.

personality_traits.name: Old-fashioned
personality_traits.description: This character is old-fashioned. Refers to a person that is behind the times, not up to date, preferring the customs of earlier times.

personality_traits.name: Optimist
personality_traits.description: This character is an optimist. Optimism is a mental attitude or world view that interprets situations and events as being best (optimized), meaning that in some way for factors that may not be fully comprehended, the present moment is in an optimum state. The concept is typically extended to include the attitude of hope for future conditions unfolding as optimal as well.

personality_traits.name: Otaku
personality_traits.description: This character is an otaku. Otaku is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, or video games.

personality_traits.name: Outgoing
personality_traits.description: This character is an extrovert. Outgoing characters tend to be fond of the company of others, assertive, and interested in seeking out excitement.

personality_traits.name: Pacifist
personality_traits.description: This character is a follower or believes in pacifism. Pacifism is the opposition to war and violence. The character does not like war or fighting. Preferring a non-violent, non-confrontational method to settle disputes.

personality_traits.name: Patriotic
personality_traits.description: The character is a patriot, a person who vigorously supports his country and its way of life. Patriotism is a devotion to one's country. In a generalized sense applicable to all countries and peoples, patriotism is a devotion to one's country for no other reason than being a citizen of that country.

personality_traits.name: Perfectionist
personality_traits.description: This character is a perfectionist. Perfectionism is a belief that work or output that is anything less than perfect is unacceptable.

personality_traits.name: Personality Complex
personality_traits.description: This is an umbrella trait to gather various personality complexes.

personality_traits.name: Pervert
personality_traits.description:
This character's mind is usually occupied by sexual thoughts.

Perverted characters think about sex all the time and they would do anything to get close to things that they consider erotic.

personality_traits.name: Pessimist
personality_traits.description: This character is a pessimist. Pessimism is a state of mind in which one anticipates undesirable outcomes or believes that the evil or hardships in life outweighs the good or luxuries. These characters typically expect everything to go wrong, often depressing others.

personality_traits.name: Pragmatic
personality_traits.description: A pragmatic person is somebody who makes decisions and takes action based on logical, practical and/or rational considerations and perspectives. It should be noted that pragmatic people aren't necessarily cold or unemotional.

personality_traits.name: Pretending
personality_traits.description:
This character is faking his or her personality.

Pretending characters hide their true personality and act like someone else. They may be acting this way because of social pressure or out of a hidden agenda.

This trait is intended for characters that are pretending all or most of their personality, do not use it for ones that pretend one or two things in a game.

personality_traits.name: Primitive
personality_traits.description: This character behaves in a primitive way, acting instinctively, and can even be described as a savage.

personality_traits.name: Proactive
personality_traits.description: The opposite of Hetare. You can rely on this type of characters to do what needs to be done. They aren't afraid to make decisions. They take the initiative and solve the problem, usually by themselves. Once they have a goal in mind, they'll approach it with prudence and tact. They usually have talent/ability or connections that they know how to make best use of. Check proactivity or conscientious for more details. Should only be used when the character acted like this for the majority of the game.

personality_traits.name: Promiscuous
personality_traits.description: This character is considered to be promiscuous. They engage in sexual activity frequently and indiscriminately with different partners. Promiscuous characters sleep around not for money like a prostitute, but for their own satisfaction. A term frequently applied to an individual who is considered to have loose sexual morals or who is sexually promiscuous is a slut. The term is generally pejorative and most often used as an insult, sexual slur or offensive term of disparagement (slut shaming). However, in recent times, there have been attempts to "reclaim" the word, while some individuals embrace the title as a source of pride.

personality_traits.name: Protective
personality_traits.description: This character acts like a doting, fawning parent towards another of the story characters. They may or may not be actual family members but "the taking under one's wing" and "protecting against dangers" are important parts of this behavior. This trait is intended for mild cases which are most usually found in parents. Extreme cases of this behavior results in acting Possessive, which is presented as a child trait to this.

personality_traits.name: Rebellious
personality_traits.description:
Refusing to be told what to do or how to act, these characters will regularly lash out at authority, either passively or overtly, and often times reject the accepted mores of society. Examples of rebellious behavior include skipping school, smoking cigarettes, and getting into frequent arguments with authority figures such as teachers and parents.

Note that the motivation behind their behavior is important. Not all smokers or school skippers, or smoking school skippers, are rebellious. Their actions have to be primarily motivated purely by the will to defy.

personality_traits.name: Refined
personality_traits.description: This character is refined. Refined characters are mostly from upper class families and are usually described as cultivated, polished, polite, courteous, civilized, courtly, genteel and elegant.

personality_traits.name: Relaxed
personality_traits.description: This character has a relaxed attitude. Relaxed characters act without anxiety or worry. They may have solid reasons for doing so, like having made all possible preparations for a situation, or they may be prepared to accept the negative consequences.

personality_traits.name: Religious Belief
personality_traits.description: This meta-trait is designed to gather all traits regarding characters' religious beliefs that came strongly forward during games' stories.

personality_traits.name: Reserved
personality_traits.description: This character is an introvert. Introvert characters tend to be more reserved, less outgoing, and less sociable. They are not necessarily loners but they tend to be satisfied with having fewer friends. Introversion does not describe social discomfort but rather social preference: an introvert may not be shy but may merely prefer less social activities.

personality_traits.name: Resilient
personality_traits.description: This character has a strong psyche allowing them to withstand most of life’s hardships without breaking, experiencing mental breakdown or going insane.

personality_traits.name: Romantic
personality_traits.description: This character is a romantic. A romantic is inclined toward or suggestive of the feeling of excitement and mystery associated with love, and/or of an idealized view of reality when it comes to romance. They value their emotions greatly, and like the subtler aspects of romance, as well as most romance-themed situations, like confessions or happy couples. They appreciate gestures that are romantically pronounced, like offering flowers, and are fans of environments that contribute to a romantic mood, like a full moon. The person may be a romantic due to a traditional upbringing, or a naive ignorance of love, sometimes influenced by fiction.

personality_traits.name: Romantically Indecisive
personality_traits.description:
This character can't make a decision between romantic interests.

Romantically indecisive characters are unsure about whom they love more and are afraid to hurt the one that would get left behind. While trying to not to hurt anyone, they cause immense grief to any parties involved.

personality_traits.name: Rude
personality_traits.description: This character is generally rude. Rudeness is a display of disrespectfulness by not complying with the social "laws" or etiquette of a group or culture. These laws have been established as the essential boundaries of normally accepted behavior. To be unable or unwilling to align one's behavior with these laws known to the general population of what is socially acceptable is to be rude.

personality_traits.name: Secretive
personality_traits.description: This character acts secretive. A secretive character is keeping an important secret, hiding something from the rest of the characters. Based on the character he/she might not mind keeping it at all. But he/she might also be under great stress either due to worry that the secret will get out or might be battling the desire to tell it and be free.

personality_traits.name: Selfish
personality_traits.description: This character is selfish. Selfishness denotes an excessive or exclusive concern with oneself; and as such it exceeds mere self interest or self concern. In that it necessarily connotes a disregard for others, it is beyond the act of placing one's own needs or desires above the needs or desires of others (self interest).

personality_traits.name: Sensitive
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is sensitive. A sensitive person is one who has or displays a quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings. They tend to be easily hurt, offended or upset.

personality_traits.name: Serious
personality_traits.description: This character has a serious personality. Serious people treat everything with an attitude of gravity and earnestness. The opposite of relaxed.

personality_traits.name: Short-tempered
personality_traits.description: This character is short-tempered. A short-tempered person is easily moved to anger. Anger is an emotion related to one's psychological interpretation of having been offended, wronged or denied and a tendency to undo that by retaliation. The external expression of anger can be found in facial expressions, body language, physiological responses, and at times in public acts of aggression.

personality_traits.name: Sleepyhead
personality_traits.description: This person loves to sleep much more, than their physical condition may require. They fall asleep readily, sometimes during the class lessons, and tends to oversleep in the mornings, being regularly late for school or work.

personality_traits.name: Sloppy
personality_traits.description: This character lacks of elegance, neatness and order. They're rarely watching their appearance, being unfamiliar with the mirror, and their apartment is in a mess most of the time.

personality_traits.name: Smart
personality_traits.description: This character is shown to be intelligent. Smart is used when referring to a person with good understanding or a high mental capacity, someone who is quick to comprehend.

personality_traits.name: Stoic
personality_traits.description:
This character doesn't display any kinds of emotions outside.

Stoic characters act like they don't have feelings, except in very rare moments, when they talk or act no emotional expressions appear on their faces nor can be noticed from their movements.

This doesn't mean these characters don't feel anything, but that they don't show any outside. They can have psychological problems resulting in this behavior or may have an another reason to act this way.

personality_traits.name: Strange
personality_traits.description: This character is considered strange by the people around. A strange character speaks and behaves in a different way then the surrounding people, who consider him/her off, odd, weird or even repulsive/attractive.

personality_traits.name: Stubborn
personality_traits.description: This character is stubborn. Stubborn characters are unreasonably, often perversely unyielding and bullheaded. They are firmly resolved or determined and resolute. Characterized by their perseverance, they are difficult to treat or deal with and resistant to treatment or efforts.

personality_traits.name: Stylish
personality_traits.description:
This character is stylish.

A stylish person is someone who tries to keep pace with the latest fashion trends to dress elegantly and/or stunningly.

personality_traits.name: Superficial
personality_traits.description: A superficial person is one who lacks substance, and tends to be materialistic. They judge others based on appearances, wealth, social standing or otherwise, purely surface values. In romantic situations, a superficial person (usually) only takes interest in those who are good-looking, rich and/or high in social value.

personality_traits.name: Superstitious
personality_traits.description: The character believes in irrational, unscientific, and/or supernatural forces.

personality_traits.name: Taciturn
personality_traits.description:
This character is taciturn.

This character is physically able to speak, but prefers to remain silent because of their serious/sullen personality or mental affliction. Apply this trait only to those who spoke at least once in the story or when there was other proof of their ability to speak.

personality_traits.name: Talkative
personality_traits.description: This character loves to talk. However, the topic he started is not always meaningful, which often annoys his companions, especially when they want to enjoy the silence.

personality_traits.name: Talking Patterns
personality_traits.description: These are the traits about notable talking patterns that make this character stand out.

personality_traits.name: Thrifty
personality_traits.description: This character is associated with Frugality. A character of this trait prefers not to be wasteful or extravagant in their resource consumption, especially with money. They might have reasons behind it, such as living in poverty, or simply being well-taught by their parents. They are often, but not necessarily, viewed by others to be stingy.

personality_traits.name: Timid
personality_traits.description: This character is timid. A timid character is someone who is lacking in courage or confidence in everyday interactions. They usually will face the challange if there are enough reasons to do so (like saving their friend, or won't watch any scary movie if it's not a popular film that will help them to blend in with others), but they scare themselves to death when facing the thing. Popular example would be Niimi Sora.

personality_traits.name: Tomboy
personality_traits.description: This character is or acts like a tomboy. A tomboy is a girl who exhibits some characteristics and or behavior considered typical of the gender role of a boy, including the wearing of typically masculine-oriented types of clothes and engaging in games and activities that are often physical in nature, and which are considered in many cultures to be the domain of boys.

personality_traits.name: Tsundere
personality_traits.description: This character is a tsundere. Tsundere is a Japanese character development process which describes a person who is initially cold and even hostile towards another person before gradually showing their warm side over time.

personality_traits.name: Uneducated
personality_traits.description: This character had little to no education. Uneducated characters never had much experience with schools or private tutors and they don't have any knowledge of any of the subjects thought in one, like mathematics, science and history. At worst case an uneducated character may not even know how to read or write. An uneducated character is different from an ignorrant one since it is not about common knowledge. Though a character may carry both of the traits.

personality_traits.name: Unlucky
personality_traits.description: This character is notably unlucky and misfortune seems to follow them.

personality_traits.name: Vindictive
personality_traits.description: This character has a vindictive nature. Such a character would be disposed or inclined to revenge, or in milder cases would hold grudges for a long time and be slow to forgive.

personality_traits.name: Violent
personality_traits.description:
This character is violent.

Violent characters prefer the usage physical force or power against others that can result in injuries, death, physiological scars or other forms of serious harm.

personality_traits.name: Whimsical
personality_traits.description: A character with this trait is whimsical. These characters act and make decisions on a whim. They change their tune on things at a moment's notice. It's often hard to tell what they're planning next.

personality_traits.name: Wise
personality_traits.description: This character is endowed with wisdom. Wisdom is the ability to think and act using knowledge, experience, common sense, and insight. This quality is usually inherent to middle-aged and old people, who have seen many things in their life, and can give a good advice to those who may need it.

personality_traits.name: Womanizer
personality_traits.description: This character is a womanizer. A person is considered a womanizer if they have frequent relationships with various women and show no sign of commitment. They may often engage in flirting. The trait can be used both for male and female characters.

personality_traits.name: Yandere
personality_traits.description: This character is a yandere. Yandere is a Japanese term for a person who is initially very loving and gentle to someone before their devotion becomes destructive in nature, often through violence. Yandere characters are mentally unstable, often using extreme violence as an outlet for their emotions. Unlike Yangire characters, yandere characters' actions are motivated by love.

personality_traits.name: Yangire
personality_traits.description: This character is a yangire. Yangire is used to describe a character who is mentally ill and snaps instantly without showing affection for the victim of their outbursts. Just like yandere characters, yangire characters star very loving and gentle, and suddenly turn out violent, but the difference is that yangire characters' actions are not related to romantic feelings.
